result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Received and Filed.

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing on 9-8-2022. 
Court is in receipt of defense motion to for an adjournment. State does not object.
Court ordered matter adjourned.. Plea and Sentencing scheduled November 8, 2022 at 3:00pm.
from Attorney Hayes and Ada Staskunas stating no objection to the adjournment request.

Received and Filed by Attorney Hayes.
Request to adjourn 9-8-2022 plea/ sentencing hearing.

Defendant Jason L Baker in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Due to court congestion, court rescheduled hearing set for today's date. Court rescheduled with parties via email correspondense. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.17.22

Defendant Jason L Baker in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 03.31.22

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Jason L Baker in court with Attorney Michael M. Hayes; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Jason L Baker in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jason L Baker in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason L Baker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT'S ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON EMPLOYMENT.  Court entered a plea of not guilty as to Count 3 on behalf of the defendant.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
